content.title: What Happened?
content.visibleText: VERSES has achieved an AGI breakthrough with their alternative path to AGI that is Active Inference. And they are appealing to Open AI 'In the spirit of cooperation and in accordance with [their] charter'.

content.title: Why Is This Significant?
content.visibleText: In a video published as part of the announcement today titled, 'The Year in AI 2023,' VERSES takes a look at the incredible journey of AI acceleration over this past year and what it suggests about the current path from Artificial Narrow Intelligence (where we are now) to Artificial General Intelligence — AGI (the holy grail of AI automation)... Noting that all of the major players of Deep Learning technology have publicly acknowledged throughout the course of 2023 that 'another breakthrough' is needed to get to AGI. For many months now, there has been overwhelming consensus that machine learning/deep learning cannot achieve AGI. Sam Altman, Bill Gates, Yann LeCunn, Gary Marcus, and many other have publicly stated so.

content.title: Chat with June - TPR
content.visibleText:
[June]: TPR meeting - Was talking to James and he mentioned that we should have a follow-up meeting to discuss the next steps.
[RM]: Read and noted. Please add a meeting notice to the team calendar, and forward needed materials.
[June]: Read and noted as directed. Will organize a meeting for next Monday.
[RM]: Please assign to @danielle, @mark, @lucy to our next dev meeting.
[June]: Will do.

windows.title: VERSES AI Announces AGI Breakthrough: Invokes Open AI’s ‘Assist’ Clause | by Denise Holt | Medium

uiElements.details: scroll bar visible on the right side

content.title: Article Content
content.visibleText:
The Godfather of AI Leaves Google and Warns of Danger
The world of artificial intelligence received a significant jolt this morning as Geoffrey Hinton, often referred to as the godfather of deep learning, announced his departure from Google. Hinton cited a range of concerns about the direction in which AI development is headed, including the potential for AI to be used in ways that could be harmful to humanity.
Image by permission from VERSES AI
So What Are The Potential Dangers of Deep Learning Neural Nets?
The many problems that pose these potential dangers of continuing down the current path of generative AI, are compelling and quite serious.
- Black box problem
- Alignment problem
- Generalizability problem
- Hallucination problem
- Centralization problem — one corporation owning the AI
- Clean data problem
